III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans,
and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A went AWOL on 06/30/2025 and no one from the facility
was aware she was gone.
Investigation Hospital Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 07/03/2025.
She reported encountering Youth A in the parking lot of the
hospital. Hospital Staff 1 confirmed that the hospital where she
works neighbors the facility and is only separated by one street.
At the time she encountered Youth A, Youth A was sitting on a
bench and Youth A was crying. In speaking with Youth A Hospital
Staff 1 was able to deduce that Youth A was placed at the facility
and had walked off campus only minutes before. Youth A initially
stated that she did not want to return to the facility but then stated
she would. Hospital Staff 1 decided to call the main phone
number for the facility and reached a secretary. The secretary
told Hospital Staff 1 she was not aware that Youth A had left
campus, but would get information and have a staff member call
her back or come to pick up Youth A. Hospital Staff 1 was then
connected to another staff member she could not recall. This staff
member was aware Youth A had left campus and was arranging
for other staff to come pick up Youth A. Hospital Staff 1 stated
staff from the facility came to pick up Youth A a short time later.
and Youth A went willingly with them.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on 08/05/2025.
She recalled the incident in question. Supervisor 1 recalled being
informed Youth A was officially AWOL by Staff 1 after the incident
occurred. A short time later she was informed by other staff Youth
A had been located and was instructed to go pick up Youth A.
She stated not being involved with Youth A when Youth A left
campus some time earlier that day. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A
being calm and cooperative when she was picked up, and she
came back to the facility willingly. She also recalled the hospital
staff Youth A was with was helpful and kind to Youth A.
2

Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 08/05/2025. She
recalled being with Youth A during the incident in question. Staff 1
could not recall exactly why Youth A was upset but confirmed she
was attempting to de-escalate Youth A and provide line-of-sight
supervision as Youth A walked off the campus property. Staff 1
recalled walking a distance behind Youth A as Youth A crossed
the street, leaving the campus property and moving onto the
hospital campus. Staff 2 recalled staying at the street corner and
keeping line-of-sight of Youth A until Youth A walked through a
parking lot and around the corner of a building out of sight. Staff 1
recalled calling Supervisor 1 at that point in time to report that
Youth A was officially considered AWOL.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone on 08/06/2025. She
recalled leaving campus after being followed to the corner of the
facility property by a staff she could not recall. Youth A recalled
walking over to the neighboring hospital parking lot and found a
bench to sit on. She believed very little time passed when she
was approached by a hospital staff member. Youth A recalled
speaking with her, but she was not sure if this hospital staff
member called the facility to report where Youth A was. Youth A
recalled being picked up by facility staff without much time
passing, and she willingly went back to the facility.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility Incident Report documentation dated 06/30/2025
was provided and reviewed. This was authored by Staff 1.
This documentation was consistent with interviews
provided. Staff 1 reported that the beginning of the incident
occurred at 1:24 pm and a Crisis Response Team member
was notified at 1:39pm. It was documented that Youth A
was then picked up at approximately 2:15 pm.
• Facility policy & procedures titled "AWOLP Policy" was
provided and reviewed. In this policy staff are instructed to
maintain a line of sight with the child as long as possible
without leaving the grounds unless a child has a specific
Individual Crisis Support Plan indicating that they are to be
shadowed off grounds" if a youth leaves the facility
property.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews as well as documentation reviewed. The facility was
aware of Youth A’s AWOL on 06/30/2025 and followed their
AWOL policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
